AutoDependencyUpgradeSettings20240531.description: Automatically create pull requests on recurring tests for dependencies as upgrades become available. If not specified, settings will be inherited from the Organization's integration.

is_major_upgrade_enabled.description: Include major version in dependency upgrade recommendation.

limit.description: Limit of dependency upgrade PRs which can be opened simultaneously. When the limit is reached, no new upgrade PRs are created. If specified, must be between 1 and 10.

minimum_age.description: Minimum dependency maturity period in days. If specified, must be between 1 and 365.

AutoRemediationPRsSettings20240531.description: Automatically raise pull requests on recurring tests to fix new and existing vulnerabilities. If not specified, settings will be inherited from the Organization's integration.

is_backlog_prs_enabled.description: Automatically create pull requests on scheduled tests for known (backlog) vulnerabilities.

is_fresh_prs_enabled.description: Automatically create pull requests on scheduled tests for new vulnerabilities.

is_patch_remediation_enabled.description: Include vulnerability patches in automatic pull requests.

include_in_recommendations.description:
Whether this image should be recommended as a base image upgrade. 
If set to true, this image could be shown as a base image upgrade to other projects.
If set to false this image will never be recommended as an upgrade.

project_id.description:
The ID of the container project that the custom base image is based off of.
The attributes of this custom base image are taken from the latest snapshot at the time of creation.
This means that no changes should be made to the original project after the creation of the custom base image,
as new snapshots created from any changes will NOT be picked up.

classes.description: A list of details for weakness data, policy, etc that are the class of this issue's source.

coordinates.description:
Where the issue originated, specific to issue type. Details on what
code, package, etc introduced the issue. An issue may be caused by
more than one coordinate.

is_fixable_manually.description: Indicates whether a issue can be fixed manually by the user. This typically involves making changes directly to the code or configuration to address the issue.

is_fixable_snyk.description: Indicates whether Snyk can automatically provide a fix for the issue. Snyk might offer solutions like patches or upgrades that can be applied directly through its platform.

is_fixable_upstream.description: Indicates whether a fix is available from the upstream source, such as the original package maintainers. It means that the issue can be resolved by updating to a version where the maintainers have already addressed the vulnerability.

is_patchable.description: Indicates whether the issue can be fixed by applying a patch. Patches are specific code changes that address vulnerabilities without requiring a full upgrade of the package.

is_pinnable.description: Indicates whether the issue can be fixed by pinning the dependency to a specific version. Pinning involves locking the dependency to a version that is known to be secure.

is_upgradeable.description: Indicates whether the issue can be resolved by upgrading the package to a newer version. Upgrading typically involves moving to a version where the vulnerability has been fixed.

correlation_id.description:
An optional identifier for correlating remedies between coordinates or across issues. They are scoped
to a single Project and test run. Remedies with the same correlation_id must have the same contents.

description.description: A markdown-formatted optional description of this remedy. Links are not permitted.

data.description: Metadata information related to apply a remedy. Limited in size to 100Kb when JSON serialized.

field.description:
field refers to the type of identifier used in the condition of the policy.  The available value is versioned and hierarchical:
- `snyk/asset/finding/v1` : identity of the finding scoped to a Snyk assets (e.g. a repository).
For a given issue, `snyk/asset/finding/v1` can be extracted from the `key_asset` field in the [issues API](https://apidocs.snyk.io/?version=2024-10-15#get-/orgs/-org_id-/issues). 
In addition, finding identities can be extracted from the fingerprints section of the SARIF, which is accessible via the Snyk CLI. More details can be found in the [CLI documentation](https://docs.snyk.io/snyk-cli/scan-and-maintain-projects-using-the-cli/snyk-cli-for-snyk-code/view-snyk-code-cli-results#export-test-results).

auth_type.description:
The authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Snyk API Key.
  * oauth_client_secret - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, which returns a client secret that can be used to retrieve an oauth access token.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.
  * access_token - Access tokens are long-lived, can be used more than once for increased flexibility, and have expiries for enhanced security.

client_id.description: The service account's attached client-id. Used to request an access-token. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_client_secret or oauth_private_key_jwt.

client_secret.description: The client secret used for obtaining oauth access tokens. Only sent on creation of new service accounts and cannot be retrieved thereafter. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_client_secret.

VersioningSchema.description:
The versioning scheme used by images in the repository.

A versioning schema is a system for identifying and organizing different versions of a project. 
It is used to track changes and updates to the project over time, and to help users identify which version they are using. 
A versioning schema typically consists of a series of numbers or labels that are incremented to reflect the progression of versions. 
For example, a versioning schema might use a series of numbers, such as "1.0", "1.1", "2.0", and so on, to indicate major and minor releases of a product. 
A consistent and well-defined versioning schema helps users and tools understand and track the development of a project.

VersioningSchemaCustomType.description:
The Custom Schema type is a way for Snyk to understand your companyโs container image tag versioning scheme,
enabling Snyk to give more accurate base image upgrade recommendations.

This schema type is essentially a regular expression that groups the different parts of an imageโs tag into comparable sections.

If your container image's tags follow a versioning scheme other than Semantic Versioning (SemVer), 
it is highly recommended that you select the "Custom Versioning" schema for your image repositories.

expression.description:
The regular expression used to describe the format of tags.
Keep in mind that backslashes in the expression need to be escaped due to being encompassed in a JSON string.

label.description:
A customizable string that can be set for a custom versioning schema to describe its meaning.
This label has no function.

VersioningSchemaSingleSelectionType.description:
The Single Selection Versioning Schema allows manual setting of which image should be given as a recommendation.

Only one image can be set as the current recommendation. If no images are set as the current selection, 
no recommendation will be given.

It is recommended to use this versioning schema if your repository's tags aren't supported by the other schemas.

is_selected.description:
Whether this image should be the recommendation. Only one image can be selected at a given time. Setting this
as true will remove previous selection.

APIToken.description: API key value must be prefixed with \"Token \".
APIToken.name: Authorization

get.description:
Get a list of custom base images with support for ordering and filtering.
Either the org_id or group_id parameters must be set to authorize successfully.
If sorting by version, the repository filter is required.

parameters.description: The ID of the container project that the custom base image is based off of.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.description: The organization ID of the custom base image
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: The group ID of the custom base image
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description:
Which column to sort by. 
If sorting by version, the versioning schema is used.
parameters.name: sort_by

200.description: Returns custom base images

get.summary: Get a custom base image collection

post.description:
In order to create a custom base image, you first need to import your base images into Snyk.
You can do this through the CLI, UI, or API.

This endpoint marks an image as a custom base image. This means that the image will get
added to the pool of images from which Snyk can recommend base image upgrades.

Note, after the first image in a repository gets added, a versioning schema cannot be passed in this endpoint.
To update the versioning schema, the PATCH endpoint must be used.

requestBody.description: The properties used in the creation of a custom base image

201.description: Successfully created a custom base image

post.summary: Create a Custom Base Image from an existing container project

delete.description: Delete a custom base image resource. (the related container project is unaffected)

204.description: Successfully deleted the custom base image

delete.summary: Delete a custom base image

get.description: Get a custom base image

200.description: Returns a custom base image

patch.description: Updates a custom base image's attributes

requestBody.description: custom base image to be updated

200.description: Returns the updated custom base image

#### Required permissions

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Group that is creating and owns the service account
parameters.name: group_id

access_token_expires_at.description: The expiry date of the access token. Required only when auth_type is access_token.

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated oauth access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1 hour if unset. Only used when auth_type is one of the oauth_* variants.

auth_type.description:
The authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Snyk API Key.
  * oauth_client_secret - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, which returns a client secret that can be used to retrieve an oauth access token.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.
  * access_token - Access tokens are long-lived, can be used more than once for increased flexibility, and have expiries for enhanced security.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL hosting your public keys, used to verify signed JWT requests. Must be https. Required only when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

name.description: A human-friendly name for the service account.

role_id.description: The ID of the role which the created service account should use. Obtained in the Snyk UI, via "Group Page" -> "Settings" -> "Member Roles" -> "Create new Role". Can be shared among multiple accounts.

201.description: A new service account has been created

parameters.description:
Filter assets by various criteria.
Provide criteria as key-value pairs within the filter object.
Supported keys: 'asset_type', 'project_id', 'target_id'.

get.description:
This endpoint lets you retrieve the SBOM document of a software project.
It supports the following formats:
* CycloneDX version 1.6 in JSON (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.6+json`).
* CycloneDX version 1.6 in XML (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.6+xml`).
* CycloneDX version 1.5 in JSON (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.5+json`).
* CycloneDX version 1.5 in XML (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.5+xml`).
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in JSON (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+json`).
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in XML (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+xml`).
* SPDX version 2.3 in JSON (set `format` to `spdx2.3+json`).

By default it will respond with an empty JSON:API response.

#### Required permissions

- `View Project history (org.project.snapshot.read)`

parameters.description: Unique identifier for an organization
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for a project
parameters.name: project_id

200.description: Returns the SBOM document of a project

post.description:
Create an SBOM test run by supplying an SBOM document. The components contained in the given document will get analyzed for known vulnerabilities. In order for component identification to be successful, they must have a PackageURL (purl) of a supported purl type assigned. Analysis will be skipped for any component that does not fulfill this requirement.
Supported SBOM formats: CycloneDX 1.4 JSON, CycloneDX 1.5 JSON, CycloneDX 1.6 JSON, SPDX 2.3 JSON
Supported purl types: apk, cargo, cocoapods, composer, conan, deb, gem, generic, golang, hex, maven, npm, nuget, pub, pypi, rpm, swift

#### Required permissions

- `Test Projects (org.project.test)`

parameters.description: Org ID
parameters.name: org_id

post.summary: Create an SBOM test run (Early Access)

get.description:
Get an SBOM test run status

#### Required permissions

- `Test Projects (org.project.test)`

parameters.description: Org ID
parameters.name: org_id

200.description: SBOM test run status

get.summary: Gets an SBOM test run status (Early Access)

get.description:
Get an SBOM test run result

#### Required permissions

- `Test Projects (org.project.test)`

parameters.description: Org ID
parameters.name: org_id

200.description: SBOM test results

get.summary: Gets an SBOM test run result (Early Access)

get.description:
Get all service accounts for an organization.

#### Required permissions

- `View service accounts (org.service_account.read)`

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Organization that owns the service accounts.
parameters.name: org_id

200.description: A list of service accounts is returned.

get.summary: Get a list of organization service accounts.

post.description:
Create a service account for an organization. The service account can be used to access the Snyk API.

#### Required permissions

- `Create service accounts (org.service_account.create)`

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Organization that is creating and will own the service account.
parameters.name: org_id

access_token_expires_at.description: The expiry date of the access token. Required only when auth_type is access_token.

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated oauth access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1 hour if unset. Only used when auth_type is one of the oauth_* variants.

auth_type.description:
The authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Snyk API Key.
  * oauth_client_secret - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, which returns a client secret that can be used to retrieve an oauth access token.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.
  * access_token - Access tokens are long-lived, can be used more than once for increased flexibility, and have expiries for enhanced security.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL hosting your public keys, used to verify signed JWT requests. Must be https. Required only when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

name.description: A human-friendly name for the service account.

role_id.description: The ID of the role which the created service account should use. Obtained in the Snyk UI, via "Group Page" -> "Settings" -> "Member Roles" -> "Create new Role". Can be shared among multiple accounts.

201.description: A new service account has been created

post.summary: Create a service account for an organization.

delete.description:
Delete a service account in an organization.

#### Required permissions

- `Remove service accounts (org.service_account.delete)`

parameters.description: The ID of org to which the service account belongs.
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: The ID of the service account.
parameters.name: serviceaccount_id

204.description: The service account has been deleted.

delete.summary: Delete a service account in an organization.

get.description:
Get an organization-level service account by its ID.

#### Required permissions

- `View service accounts (org.service_account.read)`

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Organization that owns the service account.
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: The ID of the service account.
parameters.name: serviceaccount_id

200.description: Service account is returned.

patch.description:
Update the name of an organization-level service account by its ID.

#### Required permissions

- `Edit service accounts (org.service_account.edit)`

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Organization that owns the service account.
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: The ID of the service account.
parameters.name: serviceaccount_id

name.description: A human-friendly name for the service account. Must be unique within the organization.

id.description: The ID of the service account. Must match the id in the url path.

200.description: Service account is returned.

post.description:
Manage the client secret of an organization service account by the service account ID.

#### Required permissions

- `Edit service accounts (org.service_account.edit)`

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Organization that owns the service account.
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: The ID of the service account.
parameters.name: serviceaccount_id

mode.description:
Operation to perform:
  * `replace` - Replace existing secrets with a new generated secret.
  * `create` - Add a new secret, preserving existing secrets. A maximum of to two secrets can exist at a time.
  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value. At least one secret must remain per service account.

secret.description: Secret to delete when using `delete` mode

200.description: Service account client secret has been updated.

post.summary: Manage an organization service account's client secret.

get.description:
Requires the Snyk Slack App to be set up for this org, will retrieve a list of channels the Snyk Slack App can access. Note that it is currently only possible to page forwards through this collection, no prev links will be generated and the ending_before parameter will not function.

#### Required permissions

- `Install Apps (org.app.install)`

parameters.description: Org ID
parameters.name: org_id

200.description: List of Slack channels

get.summary: Get a list of Slack channels

get.description:
Requires the Snyk Slack App to be set up for this org. It will return the Slack channel name for the provided Slack channel ID.

#### Required permissions

- `Install Apps (org.app.install)`

parameters.description: Org ID
parameters.name: org_id

200.description: List of Slack channels

get.summary: Get Slack Channel name by Slack Channel ID.

get.description:
Get a list of an organization's targets.

#### Required permissions

- `View Projects (org.project.read)`

parameters.description: Calculate total amount of filtered results
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The id of the org to return a list of targets
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: Return targets that match the provided value of is_private
parameters.name: is_private

parameters.description: Return only the targets that has projects
parameters.name: exclude_empty

parameters.description: Return targets that match the provided remote_url.
parameters.name: url

parameters.description: Return targets that match the provided source_types
parameters.name: source_types

parameters.description: Return targets with display names starting with the provided string
parameters.name: display_name

parameters.description: Return only targets which have been created at or after the specified date.
parameters.name: created_gte

200.description: A list of targets is returned for the targeted org

delete.description:
Delete the specified target.

#### Required permissions

- `Remove Projects (org.project.delete)`

parameters.description: The id of the org to delete
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: The id of the target to delete
parameters.name: target_id

204.description: The target is deleted with all projects, if it is found in the specified org.

delete.summary: Delete target by target ID

get.description:
Get a specified target for an organization.

#### Required permissions

- `View Projects (org.project.read)`

parameters.description: The id of the org to return the target from
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: The id of the target to return
parameters.name: target_id

200.description: A single target is returned if it is found in the specified org

get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of learning programs available for the specified tenant.

#### Required permissions

- `Edit Tenant Details (tenant.edit)`

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

200.description: Returns a paginated list of learning programs

get.summary: List learning programs for a tenant (Early Access)

post.description:
Creates a new learning program in DRAFT status

#### Required permissions

- `Edit Tenant Details (tenant.edit)`

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

201.description: A learning program was created successfully.

post.summary: Create a new learning program (Early Access)

get.description:
Retrieves a single learning program by its ID for the specified tenant.

#### Required permissions

- `Edit Tenant Details (tenant.edit)`

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

200.description: Returns a single learning program

get.summary: Get a single learning program for a tenant (Early Access)

get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of contents for a specific learning program.

#### Required permissions

- `Edit Tenant Details (tenant.edit)`

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

200.description: Returns a paginated list of learning program contents

get.summary: Get contents of a learning program (Early Access)

post.description:
Creates content for an existing learning program

#### Required permissions

- `Edit Tenant Details (tenant.edit)`

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

204.description: The learning program content was created successfully.

post.summary: Create learning program content (Early Access)

get.description:

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

get.description:
Returns all memberships of the tenant

parameters.description: Order in which results are returned.
parameters.name: sort_order

200.description: List of tenant memberships is returned

delete.description:

#### Required permissions

- `View Tenant Memberships (tenant.membership.read)`

- `tenant.membership.delete`

204.description: successfully deleting an individual membership for a single user

patch.description:
Update the tenant membership with the new role

#### Required permissions

- `View Tenant Details (tenant.read)`

- `View Tenant Memberships (tenant.membership.read)`

- `Edit Tenant Memberships (tenant.membership.edit)`

204.description: successfully updated the tenant membership

get.description:
List all available roles for a given tenant.

#### Required permissions

- `tenant.roles.read`

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

parameters.description: Role name filter.
parameters.name: name

200.description: Returns an array of roles that are the roles on a Tenant.

get.summary: List all available roles for a given tenant (Early Access)

post.description:
Create a custom tenant role for a given tenant.

#### Required permissions

- `tenant.roles.read`

- `tenant.roles.create`

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

post.summary: Create a custom tenant role for a given tenant (Early Access)

delete.description:
Delete a custom tenant role in a given tenant

#### Required permissions

- `tenant.roles.read`

- `tenant.roles.delete`

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

204.description: Tenant role successfully deleted.

delete.summary: Delete a specific tenant role by its id and its tenant id. (Early Access)

get.description:
Return a role from a tenant by the tenant and role id with its details and permissions.

#### Required permissions

- `tenant.roles.read`

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the tenant.
parameters.name: tenant_id

200.description: Returns the requested role.

patch.description:
Update attributes of a custom tenant role in a given tenant

- `tenant.roles.read`

- `tenant.roles.edit`

parameters.name: tenant_id

200.description: Returns the updated role.
